title: Favorability of melting tungsten at 3723 K

content.description: <math alttext="W solid produces W liquid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>W(</mtext><mi>s</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>→</mo><mtext>W(</mtext><mi>l</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="delta H naught of fusion equals 35 kilojoules per mole; delta S naught of fusion equals 10 joules per mole, kelvin" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>H</mi><msub><mrow><mi>°</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi><mi>u</mi><mi>s</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mtext>35 kJ/mol;</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>S</mi><msub><mrow><mi>°</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi><mi>u</mi><mi>s</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mtext>10 J/(mol</mtext><mo>⋅</mo><mtext>K)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: The chemical equation and thermodynamic data for the melting of tungsten are given above. Based on this information, which of the following provides the best prediction with correct justification about whether a sample of pure tungsten will melt at <math alttext="3723 kelvins" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>3723</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>K</mtext></mrow></math>?

choices.label: The sample will not melt because <math alttext="T is greater than the fraction delta H naught of fusion over delta S naught of fusion" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>T</mi><mo>></mo><mfrac><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>H</mi><msub><mrow><mi>°</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi><mi>u</mi><mi>s</mi></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>S</mi><msub><mrow><mi>°</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi><mi>u</mi><mi>s</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The sample will not melt because <math alttext="T is less than the fraction delta H naught of fusion over delta S naught of fusion" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>T</mi><mo><</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>H</mi><msub><mrow><mi>°</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi><mi>u</mi><mi>s</mi></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>S</mi><msub><mrow><mi>°</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi><mi>u</mi><mi>s</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The sample will melt because <math alttext="T is greater than the fraction delta H naught of fusion over delta S naught of fusion" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>T</mi><mo>></mo><mfrac><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>H</mi><msub><mrow><mi>°</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi><mi>u</mi><mi>s</mi></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>S</mi><msub><mrow><mi>°</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi><mi>u</mi><mi>s</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The sample will melt because <math alttext="T is less than the fraction delta H naught of fusion over delta S naught of fusion" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>T</mi><mo><</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>H</mi><msub><mrow><mi>°</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi><mi>u</mi><mi>s</mi></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>S</mi><msub><mrow><mi>°</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi><mi>u</mi><mi>s</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: The sample will melt because <math alttext="T is greater than the fraction delta H naught of fusion over delta S naught of fusion" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>T</mi><mo>></mo><mfrac><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>H</mi><msub><mrow><mi>°</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi><mi>u</mi><mi>s</mi></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>S</mi><msub><mrow><mi>°</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi><mi>u</mi><mi>s</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: 6.D: Provide reasoning to justify a claim using chemical principles or laws, or using mathematical justification.
